prompt: <description>**Part 1: Circular Object with Central Hole** The first part to construct is a circular object with a central hole. We will begin by creating a new coordinate system with the specified euler angles and translation vector. Coordinate System ```css Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.024, 0.0] ``` Next, we will create a 2D sketch on a plane defined by the coordinate system. Sketch ```vbnet Face 1: Loop 1: Circle 1: Center: [0.375, 0.375] Radius: 0.375 Loop 2: Circle 1: Center: [0.375, 0.375] Radius: 0.186 ``` In this sketch, we have two concentric circles that define the outer and inner boundaries of the circular object. Now, we will scale the 2D sketch using the `sketch_scale` parameter of 0.75. Scaled Sketch ```vbnet Face 1: Loop 1: Circle 1: Center: [0.2812, 0.2812] Radius: 0.2812 Loop 2: Circle 1: Center: [0.2812, 0.2812] Radius: 0.1406 ``` The inner and outer circles now have a radius of 0.2812 and 0.1406 respectively. Next, we will transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector. 3D Sketch ```css Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.024, 0.0] ``` Finally, we will extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model. Extrusion ```yaml Extrude Depth Towards Normal: 0.024 Extrude Depth Opposite Normal: 0.0 Sketch Scale: 0.75 ``` This operation will create a new solid body with a height of 0.75 that is joined to the previous CAD models. The final shape of this part is a circular object with a central hole. Height: 0.75 Width: 0.024 Length: 0.75 With the first part complete, we can proceed to construct the remaining parts of the CAD model.</description>

Within the sketch, create a loop (loop_1) consisting of 8 line segments (line\\_1 to line\\_8). The segments' start and end points are defined as follows: | Line | Start Point | End Point | |||| | 1 | (0, 0) | (0.25, 0) | | 2 | (0.25, 0) | (0.25, 0.125) | | 3 | (0.25, 0.125) | (0.5, 0.125) | | 4 | (0.5, 0.125) | (0.5, 0) | | 5 | (0.5, 0) | (0.75, 0) | | 6 | (0.75, 0) | (0.75, 0.25) | | 7 | (0.75, 0.25) | (0.0, 0.25) | | 8 | (0.0, 0.25) | (0.0, 0) | 3. Close the loop to form a closed boundary for the sketch. 4. Apply a scaling transformation to the sketch with a scale factor of 0.75. 5. Transform the scaled sketch into a 3D sketch by defining the coordinate system's Euler angles at (0, 0, 0) and the translation vector at (0, 0, 0). 6. Extrude the 3D sketch with the following parameters: - Extrude_depth_towards_normal: 0.25 - Extrude_depth_opposite_normal: 0.0 - Sketch_scale: 0.75 The first part is now completed, forming a rectangular prism with a tapered middle section. Move on to the next part to attach the three-dimensional rectangular prism with a tapered top and bottom. Part 2: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with Tapered Top and Bottom Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a tapered top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with a 180-degree rotation around the Z-axis and a translation vector along the Y-axis. 1. Start by drawing a 2D sketch on face_1 of the coordinate system. 2. Within the sketch, create a loop (loop\\_1) consisting of 4 line segments (line\\_1 to line\\_4). The segments' start and end points are defined as follows: | Line | Start Point | End Point | |||| | 1 | (0, 0) | (0.375, 0) | | 2 | (0.375, 0) | (0.375, 0.25) | | 3 | (0.375, 0.25) | (0.0, 0.25) | | 4 | (0.0, 0.25) | (0.0, 0) | 3. Close the loop to form a closed boundary for the sketch. 4. Apply no scaling transformation to the sketch. 5. Transform the scaled sketch into a 3D sketch by defining the coordinate system's Euler angles at (0, 0, 180) and the translation vector at (0, 0.5, 0). 6. Extrude the 3D sketch with the following parameters: - Extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal: 0.0 - Extrude\\_depth\\_opposite\\_normal: 0.5 - Sketch\\_scale: 0.375 The second part is now completed, forming a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a tapered top and bottom. Align this part with the first part you created in order to join the parts. Combining the two extruded shapes creates the final 3D model of a rectangular prism with various modifications and attachments. The dimensions of the final 3D model are taken into account during the creation process.</description>
